[ 24] have published several studies on the chemical composition of Chiliadenus glutinosus, confirming the presence of a wide variety of phytochemicals, of which about one hundred different compounds have been described to date, mainly terpenes, esters, alkanes, lactones, flavonoids, and vitamin [ 24, 25]. However, the main compounds are only camphor, borneol, lucinone, glutinone, kutdtriol, quercetin, and kaempferol.
